thought it would be fun thing for the month of October to explore some of the darker arts and sides of various genres. Tonight I will be the master of ceremonies as we take the plunge into the macabre and draw from our greatest fears and nightmares. From the twisted visions of terrifying nightmares to manifestations of what we commonly fear most, what a perfect way to start the week of Halloween! 

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings, ideas, and the theme as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! 

Also if you'd like to share anything such as art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them!

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!

Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
This event is hosted by Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special. 


Join a bunch of singles from multiple Meetup groups as we casually stroll along a 1.5-mile stretch of waterfront in Hoboken. Afterwards we'll have a few drinks and chit chat at Pier 13. Pier 13 has amazing views of the NYC skyline as well as awesome food truck options and drinks galore! 

Check out the pics from the last time we did this. We had an amazing time! My walks always bring out the most beautiful people! 

We will meet at 6 PM in front of Caffebene located at 79 Hudson Street, Hoboken, NJ 07030. The walk will start at exactly 6:30 PM so do not be late or you will miss us. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of Caffebene and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure (and you shouldn't be) you can call Beau at[masked] and he will wave you over to where the group is. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend/non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. Every 10 minutes or so I ask the men to switch with a woman they have not spoken to yet so everyone gets a chance to talk to everyone. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter

results.description:
Join Kate Smith in her Gong Meditation- Sacred Sound Healing Event at Neolyth

Celestial, cosmic, oceanic, otherworldly … words can’t really describe the experience of a gong meditation. Without a doubt, this event is a trip to the heavens, the depths and back. The sound of the gong creates an opportunity for deep and soulful relaxation, regenerating our parasympathetic system. As the gong dissolves energetic blockages, many old beliefs, patterns, habits or even physical issues that no longer serve us may come to the surface for release. The gong truly works on the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual level! Come travel to the stars with our Mother Tesla Gong and clear a path to hearing our heart’s truth, the song of our authentic self and the calling of our true intuition.

Charge: $25

results.description:
One of our group members, Lillian Vinci (Aka The Lady Trainer) is organizing this fundraiser event to raise money for Homeless LGBT Youth.

Fundraiser for homeless Youth (New Alternatives - http://www.newalternativesnyc.org/about-us/) 2015 with Christine Martucci at Stonewall Inn From 6 PM to 10 PM. 

Sergeant Martucci of Our U.S Armed Forces will fill our hearts with love on October 24th 2015 at 6 PM.

As suggested by Antonio in his comment on this event, if you cannot attend but would still like to help, you can donate directly at the group's site - New Alternatives

Christine Martucci LGBT Singer Songwriter will head line (www.ChristineMartucci.com) Drag queens , comedians, Free food, 2 for 1 Drink special & Only $10 suggested Donations.

On Headliner Christine Martucci:

We are all Angels of War," Christine Martucci would tell you as she marches triumphantly to the release of her fourth studio album Angels of War. Raised by a military father and feminist mother, Christine is no stranger to adversity. Her autobiographical EP tells tales of her struggles to find solace as a lesbian during her 10-year stint in the US Army at the height of the "Don't Ask Don't Tell" period, to her battle to recover and regain sanity after an attempt to take her own life, to her spiritual awakening, and finally - to finding peace.

Christine was raised in the small town of Readington, NJ. Throughout her life she looked to music as her comfort and escape. Over the past decade, she has refined a style that marries both raw grit and tender warmth akin to Janis Joplin and Chrissie Hynde. She has cultivated a home for herself within the historic music scene of Asbury Park and her grass-roots following of loyal supporters have dubbed themselves the "Tucci Train". Christine has opened for national recording acts including Gavin DeGraw, Michele Branch, Patty Smythe and Scandal, and Mountain.

Most recently, she teamed up with two time Grammy Award Winner Marc Swersky (Joe Cocker, Hilary Duff, Roger Daltrey) and Brielle Brown (Gedeon Luke, Jacquie Lee). Together they wrote the confessional Angels of War over a four-month period. Topping off the record are two songs co-written by renowned songwriter Charlie Midnight (James Brown, Joni Mitchell, Joe Cocker). The EP was recorded live at Shorefire Recording Studios in Long Branch, NJ and produced by Swersky. It features the musicianship of Steve Holley (Paul McCartney and The Wings) on drums, Vincent Mascolo (Tunnels to Holland), and top NYC session keyboardist Alan Markley.  At the root of Angels of War is a story of survival, resilience, and love. It's an honest portrayal of a woman who served her country and is now serving her heart.

results.description:
A Shamanic journey of ancient remembering. A healing ceremony of the Soul lead by Kevon Simpson and Caney Taino.

What is Light Of Iris?

Love Includes Growing Heights Together of Integration Responsibility Intuition and Simplicity. Light of Iris is a Shamanic healing ceremony that uses meditation, journaling, dance, drawing, music, and .... more to help facilitate lasting emotional healing and a permanent expansion of consciousness. For some that means increased creativity, for others that can mean healing deeply repressed childhood wounds in a matter of hours, for some it can mean reawakening a connection to ones ancestors and their power. It is named after my late Great Grandmother Iris Palmer who came to me in a vision as pure light during a previous ceremony. I don't have the right words to describe the impact that had on me, but we do want to share that possibility with others. This is about remembering who you are and standing in that power. To honor the privacy of our participants, no further information regarding the nature of this healing experience will be posted here. Joining this invite does not guarantee your participation.

Please send a message to find out more information, register and be added to the list.

We love you :-) ♥,
Team Iris
results.name: Light Of Iris October Ceremony

results.description:
Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with a Real Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Saddhasara is excited to be able to offer bi-weekly meditation and discussion sessions that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 06:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. This Meetup is offered free of charge as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come and invite your friends. Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together! 

About Bhante Saddhasara 

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.
results.name: Join Us for Guided Meditation and Discussion with Bhante Ariyadeva!

results.description:
The Loew's Jersey is an amazing theater that opened it's doors in 1929. There is a dedicated group of volunteers who work to maintain and restore the theater. They host (usually) monthly movie weekends and this weekend is a horror themed Double Feature!

Horror Hotel (U.S. release) or The City of the Dead (original release in England) - 1960 - B&W, Screened in an original release 35mm Print. 6:30 p.m.


A Nightmare on Elm Street - 1984 - Color, Screened in 35mm. 8:20 p.m.

Each film: $8 adults/$6 kids and seniors. There is a discount for both, but the price is not listed. Please check out the details at: http://www.loewsjersey.org/ 


There are usually inexpensive concessions available (soda, popcorn). 

If you only plan to attend one or the other, that's fine of course! Just leave a comment here so we know who to expect and when. 

Let's meet inside the lobby on the upper level between the two stair cases - in case you are lost, running late or just cannot find us - call Peter (908)[masked] or Tears (908)-447-7878. Text might be better due to being inside the theater. 

Getting there: The Journal Square PATH station is right across the street. If driving, use the address above and click here for parking information: http://www.loewsjersey.org/visiting/parking
results.name: A double feature at The Landmark Loew's Jersey

results.description:
Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law.

Liber Resh vel Helios, a ritual by Aleister Crowley, comprises four daily adorations to the Sun, to be performed at dawn, noon, sunset, and midnight. The general object is to focus the conscious mind on the center of our solar system.

"The object of this practice is firstly to remind the aspirant at regular intervals of the Great Work; secondly, to bring him into conscious personal relation with the centre of our system; and thirdly, for advanced students, to make actual magical contact with the spiritual energy of the sun and thus to draw actual force from him."
- Aleister Crowley (Confessions, p. 673) We will learn how to do this ritual, which consists of signs and recitations.

There will also be a slide show of beautiful ancient Egyptian art to help you with your visualizations.

This is chapter 8 in "Pearls of Wisdom" by James Eshelman. Copies of this book will be on sale at our meeting for $30. Purchase of the book is not necessary, though we recommend it as a great resource.

A donation of $8, or what you can afford, is asked to help us pay for the room rental.

Notice we are in a new space this time - it is street level, no stairs to climb! Very close to the A train. (Canal Street stop)


Love is the law, love under will.
results.name: Liber Resh

This meetup is organized for voices to unite and speak up about causes important to each of us. 

Our next meet up will allow everyone to speak out and will be sponsored by www.donateabox.com, a New York organization tackling the issues facing homeless youth and providing support to homeless teens across NYC. 

What is a Speak-Out. The 14th Street Speak-Out resembles an ordinary open mic. It will encourage us to share our expressions (thoughts, poems, lessons learned and experiences) that we need to get out.  It could be personal experiences that's beneficial to other and many times it's things going on in the community that isn't getting media attention we needs to be known. 

The biggest difference with a speak out and especially with our speak-out is that we want to build a community; a movement that will encourage each other with empathy and promote positive progression through sharing knowledge.

Come out and share! 

Your experiences and expressions matter!

*If you have any questions, please leave a comment.

results.description:
After dancing your zombie faces off....come join us as we zombie crawl through the BOWERY searching for food and drinks and ending up at the notorious Haunted Bowery restaurant PHEBE's BAR and GRILL where who knows...they might play Michael Jackson's THRILLER dance AGAIN! 

Come meet the Fans and share a pint or two...

Listen to the stories of Thrill The World NYC and meet the designated fans. 

**Additional Tarot card readings by Mama Zombie available too for only $20 (Cash) per person.**

results.description:
I am pleased to announce that I have set us up a private group tour with Tabitha from Jersey Shore Ghost Tours. We did this one before but not only do we have many many new members they have changed up the tour too so it will be mostly all new places and information.

Here is info from their website: Enjoy lantern-lit walking tours of this quaint shore town.  Take a step back in time as your guide, dressed in period clothing, shares with you the history and mystery of Keyport, NJ. Join us Saturday evenings, August through Halloween. Tours run rain or shine, and last approximately 1 hour and 20 minutes.  Bring your camera and see what appears in your photos!

check them out on news 9


http://www.my9nj.com/chasing-news/33483826-story


I have gotten us a private group tour for $11 but you need to buy your tickets in advance on the website click on special events, Cassie's walk on 24th: http://www.jerseyshoreghosttour.com/#!special-events-tickets/bwse3

So plan is to get your tickets (this link takes you to pay pal) and then meet us in the mini park across the street from Espresso Joe's. I plan to be there by 6:45 and after the walk we can go to Burlew's for a late dinner or snack as they are right next door. Be sure to bring your cameras as we often get lots of orbs in the photos!

Hope to see YOU there!  Love, Cassie

*If you can't make it no need to post why, we understand and will catch you next time*

results.description:
Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.  

Learn the Thriller dance, Time Warp, and more fun Halloween dance moves!

Must prepay here to confirm spot (limited space available) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Oct-24-2015_at_0700PM

Professional 1 hour lesson from Monika Matys (Get Dance) that will teach you how to dance at any kind of club/party. We'll work on dancing with rhythm, musicality, coordination, and groove... to the best Halloween dance music! 

This lesson also includes admission to our after party immediately following, where you will be able to practice the moves you just learned! 

1st 15 tickets available for $15 ($20 after that) Must Prepay - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Oct-24-2015_at_0700PM

This is a Multi-Meetup event.  Expect 20-30 members to attend.  It is not meant to be age specific or gender balanced.  

See more info about the after party here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Oct-24-2015_at_0700PM

results.description:
UPDATE - Please note that your RSVP is valid only if you register and pre-pay via the link at the bottom of this post due to ingredients and preparation required before the workshop. Registration will end at noon on Thursday, 10/22. Thank you for your understanding & hope to see you all this coming Saturday!

Did you know that there are over 100 types of kimchi known in Korea? In this season of 'kimjang,' when neighbors get together and make kimchi in bulk in late fall/early winter, we will bring the kimjang community spirit to Manhattan and make a variety of this pungent, spicy goodness!

We'll start with a short introduction of kimchi, how it has evolved over time and discuss its variety. Then we'll make 3 types of the most popular kimchi and guide you through important steps and point out certain changes to look out for along the way, which will help you not only keep making the three delicious kimchi at home, but also start making kimchi with a variety of other fruits and vegetables with your own spin on this tradition. We'll also prepare a traditional spread eaten on the day of kimjang, and cook with kimchi to further expand your appreciation of lip-smackingly delicious versatility of kimchi!

On the menu:
Baechu kimchi 배추김치 - Spicy Napa cabbage kimchi
Kakdugi 깍두기 - Spicy radish kimchi
Dongchimi 동치미 - Radish stick kimchi in chilled vegetable broth (Not spicy, vegan)
Bossam 보쌈 - Pork belly wraps with fresh kimchi, salted shrimp, ssamjang and leafy greens
Kimchi jeon 김치전 - Savory kimchi pancakes
Rice

Price: $95
Maximum 10 people
Registration is required for this event at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/time-to-kimchi-tickets-18678973312


Hope to see many of you there!
results.name: Make Kimchi!

results.description:
Are you craving deeper connections in your life?

Do you want to experience more awareness/presence in your day to day life ?

Do you ever have the feeling that you could be enjoying richer more authentic interactions with people?

Sometimes creating profound connection is as easy as looking just beneath the surface with whoever we are with, at any given time and simply being more present with what actually is.

Join The Connection Movement and Authentic Relating NYC at Reflections Yoga for social games that invite us beneath the surface and into a deeper experience of ourselves and others.

Authenticity Games are a fun, highly-interactive partner and group exercise that explore ways of seeing, connecting, appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level. They are a safe and structured way for us to go beyond small talk and beyond superficial appearances.

It’s an opportunity for us to have fun and celebrate with great people who are also wanting to explore what’s possible in connection.

Join us for some fun relational games, socializing, and snacks

Bring a friend, or come alone and meet some awesome new people.

When we celebrate and explore what makes each of us unique, we often end up realizing just how much we all have in common.

Games Night begins at 7 pm and will wrap up around 10 pm - we generally visit, eat, socialize, do acro-yoga, and hang out in cuddle-piles after the games wrap up. Hope you'll plan on lingering with us.

TO PAY IN ADVANCE: http://relatinggames.eventbrite.com/

Payment:
$30 at the door
$25 in advance Reflections Yoga
227 East 24th Street
between 3rd and 2nd

(NOTE - the address for Reflections on Google Maps and Reflections' mobile site have not been updated to indicate the NEW location on East 24th Street)

Follow The Connection Movement on Facebook
www.facebook.com/theconnectmove

For updates on authentic relating events in New York, join our Meetup or Facebook groups

http://www.meetup.com/Authentic-Relating-NY

https://www.facebook.com/groups/authenticrelatingnyc/

results.description:
COME JOIN US AS WE GO "WILD IN WESTCHESTER" FOR A NIGHT FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, DINING, DANCING, AND ADVENTURE AT OUR  SOIREE ON THE GREEN, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING BY THE GREEN.

Just 30 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk and Nanuet, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

11 0THER  GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

MEET PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING OVERLOOKING THE MAPLE MOOR GOLF COURSE.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP ONLY!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

BRING A FRIEND

Bring someone you know, a friend, a neighbor, a fellow co-worker or grab an ex-relationship and get down to one of the best Social Mixers around!

THE MUSIC

TWILIGHT ENTERTAINMENT will be playing all your favorite hits as they spin your music from the past to the present!
We'll have all your favorite dance tunes playing so there's something for everyone's musical taste!


COVER CHARGE

There will be a $5 cover at the door for this event regardless whether you're dining or just at the bar.

Please pay as you arrive and <a>exact change</a> will be appreciated. Thank You!

PARKING

We have all the convenient Parking you'll need right in front of the restaurant. After parking enter through the side door.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

Just 30 min. from Norwalk, 40 min. Danbury, and 20 min. from Stamford.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nyac-experience-night-vertical-tour-the-cathedral-of-st-john-the-divine-tickets-19036029276

Join New York Adventure Club on Saturday, October 24, for an exclusive after hours vertical tour of The Cathedral of St. John's the Divine, the largest cathedral in the world. 


On this adventurous behind-the-scenes tour, held after St. John's has closed to the public, we will climb more than 124 feet through spiral staircases to the top of the world's largest cathedral. 


Learn stories through stained glass windows and sculpture, and study the grand architecture of the Cathedral while standing on a buttress. The tour culminates on the roof with a sweeping view of Manhattan. 


Click here to see pictures from our last visit! 


After the tour, we'll head to a local eatery for some food and drinks! 


*Please wear a comfortable pair of shoes as we'll be walking and stair-climbing for the duration of the tour!*
results.name: NYAC Experience: Night Vertical Tour @ The Cathedral of St. John the Divine

results.description:
Carl Levine will call a lively program of contras accompanied by Brooklyn Swing Ensemble!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance with Carl Levine and the Brooklyn Swing Ensemble!

Hi All!

It was great meeting some of you last weekend!

We are planning a meet up in queens to facilitate some of the members further out East! (Of course everyone is welcome though)

If you can't make it, no worries! We'll have plenty more to come.

Mingle, network, drink and make plans to carpool 

Intro the group

Intro ourselves

Call for drivers and riders

Discuss best practices and operations for the group

Open mic

Bring your friends!

results.description:
So let's wander over to Lincoln Center and see a performance of the American Ballet with the very talented and beautiful Misty Copeland. 

What an stellar lineup they have of iconic choreographers from Balanchine to Twyla Tharp. This is going to be one amazing evening of dance!Listed below are the dances to be performed this evening! I cannot wait!

COMPANY B
Choreography by Paul Taylor |  Songs sung by The Andrews Sisters

In the shadow of the Second World War, this modern classic brings 1940s American life center stage as young lovers lindy, jitterbug and polka to the ebullient songs of The Andrews Sisters, including “Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy,” “Tico-Tico” and “Bei Mir Bist du Schön.”


LE SPECTRE DE LA ROSE
Choreography by Michel Fokine |  Music by Carl Maria von Weber

The fragrant scent of a rose and the memories of a young girl's first ball inspire her dreams in Fokine's haunting Le Spectre de la Rose. Its soaring leaps are legendary, and its tale of first love's awakening is timeless.


VALSE-FANTAISIE – COMPANY PREMIERE
Choreography by George Balanchine |  Music by Mikhail Glinka

Deceptively simple but fiendishly difficult, this Balanchine jewel charms with windswept dancing in perpetual motion, perfectly attuned to the joyfulness of Glinka’s waltz rhythms.


THE BRAHMS-HAYDN VARIATIONS
Choreography by Twyla Tharp |  Music by Johannes Brahms

An ABT commission for the Company’s 60th Anniversary in 2000, The Brahms-Haydn Variations bursts with invention as Tharp explores Brahms’ shimmering score, while brilliantly reaching a new peak of the choreographer’s opus for large-cast classical ballets.

TO RESERVE YOUR PLACE:

When you RSVP, you will be placed on the waitlist until I receive your payment for the ticket.  When payment is received, you will  be placed on the YES list. I will secure a block of seats together in the rear orchestra. Please respond no later than  September 1st, so I can get us the best possible seats. Responses will be closed at that time.  You only have 1 week to respond and pay me if you would like to join us.


 Tickets:  Tickets are $88.  You can either mail me a check (message me and I'll send you my mailing address) or you can use PAYPAL. You can PAYPAL me as a family or friend to [masked] no later than September 1st!

DINNER

I have made dinner reservations for 10 at Atlantic Grill  which is near Lincoln Center  for 5:30 PM. Their address is  49 W 64th St, New York, NY. They have a lovely menu which you can view here http://www.atlanticgrill.com/menus-and-food/?id=lincoln-center

Everyone has responded that they will be joining us for dinner.
results.name: The American Ballet Theater with Misty Copeland at Lincoln Center

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

results.description:
For the past 15+ years, we've turned every Saturday before Halloween into the LARGEST HALLOWEEN party in NYC!! 

This October 24th will be our BIGGEST one yet! We start at 8pm and go until 3am so come early and/or party late! You'd be ghoulish to miss it :) 

What to expect: 

• 2 FOR 1 DRINKS (8-9pm & 12-1am) 

• Live DJ spins the ultimate party music

• FREE Candy & Chocolates

• Giveaways All Night Long

• Best Costume Prizes (Costumes encouraged, not mandatory) 

• 300 members + 2 floors + 2 bars = 1 spooktacular time!

Tickets are normally $15 but the first 5 members of this group ONLY can get FREE tickets by using discount code "FREE" at checkout - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/halloween2015/ 

Is this event private?  

Yes. The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests. 

Is this age or ethnic specific? 

No. All are welcome 21 and older. 

Can I come alone?  

Yes. Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you will have a great time. 

Why does your RSVP say +99 ?

30+ groups are co-organizing so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending. We'll have 300+ in attendance as we have had in past years. This is our 18th!

results.description:
I am only posting this for informational purposes. It sounds interesting, although it is expensive (I'm a member). I always wanted to explore Green-Wood by night. As the date gets closer, we can see if more people are interested. Although, many of Green-Wood's events sell out pretty quickly, but, if this doesn't work out, there are plenty of others.
Into the Veil: An After Dark Exploration
Saturday, October 24, 8:00 pm - 1:00 am Into The Veil

Where Green-Wood’s Gothic arch rises above Brooklyn there exists a portal between the land of the living and the realm of the dead. Since the 19th century, that brownstone gate has represented the connection between those two spaces. On this special autumn evening, cross that portal and join Green-Wood and Atlas Obscura for a night of exploration and discovery. Attendees will make their own ways, on their own unique adventures, weaving together stories from the 560,000 lives interred across Green-Wood’s historic 478 acres. Navigating below the silhouettes of thousands of starlit trees, curiosity will lead you through winding pathways, revealing hidden spaces of music, history, and experience. Music performances, readings, stargazing, and other activities will unfold over the course of the night, and each attendee will choose where their own night will lead. Just as Green-Wood was designed as a place for Victorian New Yorkers to step between the veil of life and the afterlife, so too will modern visitors transport into a liminal space where the city’s past and present meet.

$60 for members of Green-Wood and BHS/$65 for non-members.

Green-Wood members can buy tickets to all public programs before the general public. Please enter the members’ password below. Tickets to this event for nonmembers will go on sale shortly. To become a member and buy tickets now, visit the membership page.
results.name: Just an interesting event in October at Greenwood...

results.description:
COME JOIN US AS WE GO "WILD IN WESTCHESTER" FOR A NIGHT FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, DINING, DANCING, AND ADVENTURE AT OUR  SOIREE ON THE GREEN, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING BY THE GREEN.

Just 30 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk and Nanuet, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

11 0THER  GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

MEET PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING OVERLOOKING THE MAPLE MOOR GOLF COURSE.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP ONLY!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

BRING A FRIEND

Bring someone you know, a friend, a neighbor, a fellow co-worker or grab an ex-relationship and get down to one of the best Social Mixers around!

THE MUSIC

TWILIGHT ENTERTAINMENT will be playing all your favorite hits as they spin your music from the past to the present!
We'll have all your favorite dance tunes playing so there's something for everyone's musical taste!


COVER CHARGE

There will be a $5 cover at the door for this event regardless whether you're dining or just at the bar.

Please pay as you arrive and <a>exact change</a> will be appreciated. Thank You!

PARKING

We have all the convenient Parking you'll need right in front of the restaurant. After parking enter through the side door.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

Just 30 min. from Norwalk, 40 min. Danbury, and 20 min. from Stamford.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

results.description:
We have had some local players tell us the field is usually empty these nights. The parks dept refuses to give us a permit for the time. I am willing to try and see if we can get the games in on the off weeks until the Winter Season starts on 12/5, when we have the permit for every Saturday again.

Please remember we have no permit. I will hold the game and hope for the best. Their will be no payment for this game.

Same Rules Apply

Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) Keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot. No-Shows will be banned from the group.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - No Permit - But Empty Field

results.name: WILD IN WESTCHESTER @ NORTH STREET *MULTI*GROUP*EVENT*

venue.name: NORTH STREET TAVERN @ The Maple Moor Golf Club

results.description:
COME JOIN US AS WE GO "WILD IN WESTCHESTER" FOR A NIGHT FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, DINING, DANCING, AND ADVENTURE AT OUR  SOIREE ON THE GREEN, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING BY THE GREEN.

Just 30 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk and Nanuet, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

11 0THER  GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

MEET PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN A WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING OVERLOOKING THE MAPLE MOOR GOLF COURSE.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP ONLY!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

BRING A FRIEND

Bring someone you know, a friend, a neighbor, a fellow co-worker or grab an ex-relationship and get down to one of the best Social Mixers around!

THE MUSIC

TWILIGHT ENTERTAINMENT will be playing all your favorite hits as they spin your music from the past to the present!
We'll have all your favorite dance tunes playing so there's something for everyone's musical taste!


COVER CHARGE

There will be a $5 cover at the door for this event regardless whether you're dining or just at the bar.

Please pay as you arrive and <a>exact change</a> will be appreciated. Thank You!

PARKING

We have all the convenient Parking you'll need right in front of the restaurant. After parking enter through the side door.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

Just 30 min. from Norwalk, 40 min. Danbury, and 20 min. from Stamford.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 25 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

results.description:
You are invited to the following event: NYC's LARGEST Halloween Meetup Party (2 For 1 Drinks, DJ, Costume Prizes, Candy) 

NYC's LARGEST Halloween Meetup Party (2 For 1 Drinks, DJ, Costume Prizes, Candy)

Saturday, October 24, 20158:30 PM to 3:00 AM

Croton Lounge

108 W. 40th St. , New York, NY

For the past 15+ years, we've turned every Saturday before Halloween into the LARGEST HALLOWEEN party in NYC!! 

This October 24th will be our BIGGEST one yet! We start at 8pm and go until 3am so come early and/or party late! You'd be ghoulish to miss it :) 

What to expect: 

• 2 FOR 1 DRINKS (8-9pm & 12-1am) 

• Live DJ spins the ultimate party music

• FREE Candy & Chocolates

• Giveaways All Night Long

• Best Costume Prizes (Costumes encouraged, not mandatory)

• 300 members + 2 floors + 2 bars = 1 spooktacular time!

Admission:

$10 limited discount tix at - http://MeetupTickets.com

$15 after that online (limited # of advance tix will be sold) 

$20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o (space permitting)

Is this event private?  

Yes. The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests. 

Is this age or ethnic specific?  

No. All are welcome 21 and older. 

Can I come alone?  

Yes. Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you will have a great time. 

Why does your RSVP say +99 ?

30+ groups are co-organizing so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending. We'll have 300+ in attendance as we have had in past years. This is our 18th! 

What's the best way to get tickets? 

Buy them now/ in advance at http://MeetupTickets.com

Tickets may sell out before event night !!!

When Saturday, October 24, 2015 at 8:30 PM - Sunday, October 25, 2015 at 3:00 AM (EDT) -                           

 Where Croton Reservoir Tavern - 108 West 40th Street New York, NY 10018

Photo ID 21+ Required

Join us for our Halloween party on 10/24, next Saturday night

Buy tix now/ in advance at

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nycs-largest-halloween-meetup-party-2-for-1-drinks-dj-costume-prizes-candy-tickets-19049040192

, past years we have sold out before event night !!!
results.how_to_find_us: call/text 917-868-4268 @ 11:30pm meeting upstairs

results.description:
Years ago we did this ghost tour and it was well received. Thus, I have decided to put it up again so that our new members can experience it:

http://www.hauntedcityghosttours.com/haunted-nyc/

New York City has long been called one of the most haunted cities in America, but its dark secrets and sordid past run much deeper than you’d ever expect. We take you deep into the underworld of one of NYC’s most beloved neighborhoods: Greenwich Village. Now a hub for trendy restaurants, celebrity pads and hangouts for NYC’s elite, Greenwich Village was once home to parlor houses, speakeasies and gambling halls - and all the debauchery that followed. On this tour, visit the infamous "House of Death," the NYU hall that Edgar Allen Poe haunts and many more ghostly sites. The shadowy past of this quaint neighborhood still haunts the city today. Learn all the darkest secrets of this one-time crib of sin on a haunted walking tour through Greenwich Village, NYC.

Get your tickets cheaper on Groupon.
results.name: Haunted NYC Tour

results.description:
This event is the first of the "Reach-Out" for New Events initiative - to do more events like J-Dog's Climbing Day...


Please RSVP Early, so I can let them know how many Nine-Ball Ninjas will be attacking them!

So let's see if we have any Nine-Ball Ninjas in the group!

Now I know, some of you might be thinking to yourself; but wait, I'm a billiard n00b. That's not a problem for three very important reasons:

• 1 - In Nine-Ball, it's all about the finish. The other player could get all eight of the balls in, but if you sink the Nine-Ball, you win. (... and you don't have to "call" pockets, "slop" counts.)

• 2 - I'm willing to show up at 8 PM and give a brief one-hour clinic on billiards. Ironically, the less experience the better (you've no bad habits... ;-)

• 3 - It's about having fun, and I'm hoping we'll have enough people for a few tables.

So please, RSVP quickly, so that I can let them know how many tables we need for our F&G Nine-Ball Ninjas!

The kitchen is open until 11PM, and the tables are $20 per hour for the group (no matter how many ppl are "on" a table.)

Not everyone will be playing at the same time, so this should work out well... I'm thinking a table for every six people. (Standard Rate is $5/person/hour whether they play or not.)  Also, if you want to just come, eat, and socialize; that's all good too!

Note: Please PM (and comment as well if you'd like) to let me know if you'll be showing up at 8PM for the clinic.

Thanks, and I look forward to shooting some stick with you all!!!

George
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the F&G Signs!  :-)
results.name: ReachOut01 - AddOn - Fun & Games with Nine-Ball Ninjas! Please RSVP Early!!!

results.description:
Hey Everyone! We're meeting up for a fun standup show called After Hours Comedy at Gotham Comedy Club on Saturday, October 24 at 10:45pm!

Gotham is one of the BEST and CLASSIEST clubs in NYC and the show is in their Vintage Lounge. Tickets are $15 each with a two drink purchase minimum and are available through this link:

http://gothamcomedyclub.com/event.cfm?id=402051&cart

The show is called "After Hours: Comedy" and features all professional comedians (no amateurs), who you've seen on: Comedy Central, HBO, MTV, Late Night TV, and more! Keep your weekend fun flowing and unwind from a long week at work.

The show starts at 10:45pm but they request you all arrive inside the club by 10:15pm to get your seats. There is a large table on one side of the room that we will reserve depending upon how many RSVPs we get. We usually have people start arrive around 10 so you can grab a drink and mingle and make friends before the show starts.

Gotham Comedy Club has a 2 drink minimum per person (drinks don't have to be alcohol)

Can't wait to see you all at the show!
results.name: After Hours Comedy at Gotham Comedy Club!

results.description:
New Date: 10/25 Sunday


The weather will finally cool down a bit. Let's play paintball again. Good News: Plenty free parking at municipal parking lot in Flushing & free street parking in NYC on Sunday.


Founded in 1982, our 130 acres of wooded terrain have offered the best playing fields for paintball. Our wooded fields have been called the best in the world, and the first four Paintball World Cups took place at our game site.

Through the more than 30 years we have developed unique theme fields that promise more variety of play for our customers. Check out the 16 different courses we have to offer. We can accommodate groups of[masked] players, so grab your friends and see why thousands of players experience paintball at our facility! Great Yelp Review!

Date: October 25th Sunday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier than. We will depart sharp on time. (Event Time: 10:00 AM- 4:00 PM)

Depart 7:30 AM: [masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Outside Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel) (Map). Free parking at the municipal parking lot across the street on Sunday.

Depart 8:15 AM: (Garden City Deli) Corner of 43rd St and 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map); plenty free street parking on Sunday.

Return: Depart from Mountain after lunch around 4:00 PM & get back NYC around 5:30 PM & Flushing 6:00 PM.

What: 5 Hours Paintball Fight in private field & our own referees

Includes:

• High Quality Semi Automatic Paintgun
• Initial Co2 air fill (20 oz.)
• Goggles and Mask system
• Private field
• 500 paintballs
• Luxury Bus/Van Transportation


What to Bring: Water, cloth, pants and shoes you don't mind get painted

Cost: Early Birds $69 for first 8 spots or 14 days in advance; Regular $79 afterward. Additional 500 paintballs can be purchased at the field at $25. Lunch ( pizza+drink) can be purchased from the food vendor at the field at group price $5 or bring your own lunch.

Buy Ticket Here: http://sep2015paintball.eventbrite.com You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate where you will be boarding (Manhattan or Flushing). Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.


Max: 20

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $10 processing fee if cancelled on or before 2 weeks prior to the event date;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $10 processing fee.

FAQ: Click the Link

Paintball Sports New York: Click the Link

A Good Video at Paintball Sports NY:

https://youtu.be/zSH31Wl_e5Q

https://youtu.be/zSH31Wl_e5Q

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details: 
8:00am, Starbucks in Sunnyside; 10:00–11:00 minute pace.

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short. If you're a faster runner, please study the route in case you wish to run ahead.  

Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance. This is for your health, safety, and comfort. 

- - - - - -  
Please see our full calendar of events 
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/ 
connect with us on Google+ 
http://www.google.com/+WoodsideSunnysideRunners 
like us on Facebook 
https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners 
and follow us on Instagram 
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/

results.name: Mid-Packers LSD Run (12-20 Miles)

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).

We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

Registration is now open please visit:

http://bikenyc.org/tourdebronx

 Ride the Tour de Bronx!The Ride

Join nearly 6,000 cyclists as they hit the road for the Tour de Bronx, the largest free cycling event in New York State.

With a choice of either a 25 or 40-mile course through the borough’s 61 neighborhoods, there will be fun for families, casual riders and avid bicyclists. 

Men and women of all ages as well as children participate in this annual event. Every year local, national and even international visitors make their way to the Bronx just to be a part of the “Big Bronx Ride!”

With a choice of either a 25 or 40-mile course through the borough’s 61 neighborhoods, there will be fun for families, casual riders and avid bicyclists.

Men and women of all ages as well as children participate in this annual event. Every year local, national and even international visitors make their way to the Bronx just to be a part of the “Big Bronx Ride!”

Presented by the Bronx Borough President Ruben Diaz, Jr. and Transportation Alternatives and produced by the Bronx Tourism Council, the Tour de Bronx promotes bicycling and pedestrian environmentally-friendly methods of travel.

All Riders must check-in on the morning of the tour.

Routes: The 40 mile


This quicker-paced ride ventures farther afield to visit iconic Bronx sites like City Island, Woodlawn Cemetery and SUNY Maritime College. This ride is recommended for experienced cyclists comfortable riding in traffic .THERE IS NO SAFETY CELL ON THIS RIDE. Kids under 16 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.

The 25 mile

A leisurely ride that's great for every age and skill level. Enjoy Bronx Greenway bike paths, parklands, shoreline and more. Riders will be accompanied by marshals and NYPD escorts. This family-friendly ride is a great way to see the Bronx from behind your handlebars.

Getting There

The 2015 tour starts at the Bronx County Building at Grand Concourse & 161st Street and ends with a music festival at the New York Botanical Garden

Date:Sunday, October 25, 2015

results.description:
---RAIN CANCELS THIS RIDE!---

Start Time: 9:00 a.m.
Estate Tour Start Time: 12PM***(see below)

Start/End Point: ------- 
Destination: Washington Irving's House in Irvington, NY
Mileage: 20 miles one-way, 40 miles round-trip
Terrain: Fairly easy with few major hills. Some bumps, but half the route is traffic-free!

Get your bike-friendly costume and ride with us to Washington Irving's house, Sunnyside, in Irvington, NY! We'll ride from the Bronx to visit the beautiful home of the writer responsible for "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow" and "Rip Van Winkle".

We'll leaf-peep and enjoy the scenery on our way to some culture! There are Metro-North train stops along the way if you choose to peel off before the ride ends. (Just make sure you have your bike permit!)

Once at Irving's house, Sunnyside, we'll be treated to a Halloween-esque tour, Legend Behind the Legend. There is a $14 admission fee for this fun. The price includes entry into the author's beautiful mini-estate along the Hudson River. Coffee and doughnuts will be available for purchase. Also bring enough money for your incidentals, including Metro-North transportation costs for the ride back. *Riders are welcome to ride back on their own.*

If this ride sounds like fun but you are unsure of your riding level, come out! You can always turn back if you want.

As usual, helmets, closed-toe/rubber-soled shoes, and spare tubes are required for this ride.

---RAIN CANCELS THIS RIDE!---


RIDE COST: Free
***TICKET COST: $14 for 12PM tour and admission to Sunnyside estate. 
ADVANCE TICKET PURCHASE REQUIRED: Click here to buy your tickets!

***Each rider is responsible for advance purchase of tickets. We cannot guarantee entry for riders who do not buy their tickets online.***


NOTE: If you can swing reading one or two of Washington Irving's short stories before the ride, it may enhance your overall experience.

**Make sure to call (917)[masked] by 8PM on Saturday to confirm your RSVP for this ride.**

Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].

Enjoy a fun and relaxing crisp fall day out of the city! The Hudson Valley is America’s oldest wine making and grape-growing region.  Less than an hour and a half from New York City, a visit to to the Hudson Valley Wineries and wine trails offers hospitable winery tasting rooms, where you can often meet the owners and taste award-winning wines made from classic European varieties, regional hybrids and even delicious fruit wines. Join us for this fun day where you will enjoy a spectacular Summer day out of the city, taste great wines and meet a fun group of NYSN members and friends.  If you have been to the Long Island wineries, this is a totally different experience!  Hudson Valley Wineries are less crowded, less commercialized and the scenery blows the Long Island Wineries away especially with the fall foliage!

-You will start your day with the beautiful train ride on Metro North from Grand Central alongside the Hudson.  Along the way you will be treated to spectacular views of the Hudson Valley. You may also drive or meet the group there if you live north of the city. Please contact [masked] to make arrangements.

-Your guide will meet you in Poughkeepsie then bring you to several local wineries including one that the group will sit and eat lunch at.

-We will also have a chance to stop at a local farm stand for those who would like to bring home some fresh fruits and veggies.

$55 ($45 V.I.P. Members) includes: Transportation from train to all wineries and attractions. (Wineries will likely include many of the following: Robibero, Nostrano, Benmarl, Stoutridge and White Cliff ) Since everyone will not be drinking, winery fee's are not included. Some wineries are free and some charge $6-$8 for a flight of samples (5-6 samples at each depending on the winery).

What to bring:

-bag lunch-Dress for the weather.  Casual and comfortable.-a large backpack or bag if you wish to bring home vegetables from local farm stand or bottles of wine. Can you come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be on their own. What to expect: 7 fun and friendly people Who is the host:  Dave Cervini What is not included? Lunch, train fare, winery fee's (budget $12- $18 if you plan to drink at more than 3 wineries) tips for the servers (optional)

When we are finished, your guide will bring you to the Poughkeepsie train station for the relaxing ride home.

We go rain or shine. Estimated return time to Poughkeepsie train will be 5:50pm.

Robibero Winery tasting 

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
</a>

Hi everyone,

Randall's Island is a player's heaven. it has gazillions of fields and open space. Make sure to check what field we will use on the map below. 

CARPOOL: Also, if you are driving, please carpool with other players. The meeting spot in Manhattan is 124th street and 2nd avenue 30 minutes before kickoff time.

BIKING: You can also bike there using the footbridge on 103rd street and FDR drive or you can use the RFK Bridge Walkway

A link to better view this map is here: <a href="http://files.meetup.com/526560/Randalls%20Island%20Fields%20Map.pdf">RANDALL'S ISLAND MAP

Please be at the field 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt. We will play for 1.5 hous and you can use cleats since it's a grass field. 


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 45-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use cleats or turf shoes. Cleats are recommended since it's grass.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and big goals-we rotate being goalie.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Click here for: Field Location Map.To see an aerial view of the field on Bing Maps: Aerial Map

DirectionsYou can get to Randall's Island by car, bus, walking or biking. Here is the link to the directions: Getting to Randall's Island

The best ways to get there are:


-Taking the A,C,D, 4,5 or 6 train to 125th st stop and walking or biking east over the RFK Bridge.

-Also, taking the M35 bus from the NW corner of 125th Street and Lexington Ave.

-Also biking across the Walk way located on 103rd street and FDR Drive.

If you have any questions about getting there please e-mail or all us at[masked]

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is grassso please bring cleats, sneakers or all terrain shoes.

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for the next game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :).

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
